question: I am writing on behalf of my sister.  Since my sister was 19 years old she has been suffering from an unknown illness/symptoms.  She has been tested for diabetes and hypoglacymia (sp?) and was told she had irregular sugars but was NOT diabetic.  Doctors told her that she needed to eat smaller and more frequent meals throughout the day.My sister is now 33 and stills suffers from a variety of symptoms and most doctors tell her its in her head and now brush off that it could be hypoglacymia (sp?).  Her symptoms are as follows:frequesnt urinationdizzinesshaky feeling during the daylow blood pressure (was told by Dr. to eat more salt)waking up in the middle of the night and having the feeling of passing out and needing to eat something quickfeeling of being sick to her stomachShe packs food with her in case she gets this feeling (oranges, ganola bars, etc.)What could this be and why is it so hard for drs to diagnose her.   All they seem to do is blood work and when that comes back all fine, they say its in her head.  My whole family knows its not in her head.  These symptoms really exsist and I feel awful for her.    She has been suffering for years.  Can you please help direct us to a diagnosis.
title: For my Sister
